title: CVS, Walgreen Want Coupon Patents Snipped Under Alice
content:
,  5:22 PM ET) -- Three patents for processing coupons should be invalidated because they qualify as abstract ideas under the U.S. Supreme Court’s Alice ruling, according to a motion filed Tuesday in Texas federal court by three pharmacy chains facing infringement claims. 
The patents held by Advanced Marketing Systems LLC are directed toward the abstract idea of offering, tracking and processing discounts while reciting conventional and generic equipment without an inventive concept to render their claims patent-eligible, alleged the three chains, CVS Pharmacy Inc., Walgreen Co. and Brookshire Grocery Co....
